## More Examples

See more examples that demonstrate how the techniques/principles from this workshop can be applied in practice:

::: {.grid-2}
::: {.resource-card}
::: {.content}
#### [NHANES Manuscript Example](examples/nhanes-manuscript/)
A complete Quarto Manuscripts project demonstrating `{{< embed >}}` syntax, script-based tables, and reproducible figures. Notice that the project is for demonstration purposes only, and **the content itself is not scientifically meaningful.** View the [source folder on GitHub](https://github.com/shibakoichiro/20260120-reproducibility-workshop-public/tree/main/examples/nhanes-manuscript).
:::
:::

::: {.resource-card}
::: {.content}
#### [Quantitative Bias Analysis](examples/Bias_analysis_reproducible.html)
A practical application: custom R functions combined with `purrr::map()` to iterate bias analysis across multiple scenarios. Demonstrates real-world use of workshop concepts. View the [source file on GitHub](https://github.com/shibakoichiro/20260120-reproducibility-workshop-public/blob/main/examples/Bias_analysis_reproducible.html).
:::
:::
:::

## Keep Learning

### Core Tools

| Resource | What You'll Learn |
|----------|-------------------|
| [Quarto Documentation](https://quarto.org) | Documents, presentations, websites, manuscripts |
| [Happy Git with R](https://happygitwithr.com) | Git setup, workflows, troubleshooting for R users |
| [gtsummary](https://www.danieldsjoberg.com/gtsummary/) | Publication-ready summary and regression tables |
| [ggplot2 Book](https://ggplot2-book.org/) | The complete guide to the grammar of graphics |

### Advanced Topics

| Resource | When to Explore |
|----------|-----------------|
| [targets User Manual](https://books.ropensci.org/targets/) | When your projects have complex dependencies |
| [Oh Shit, Git!?!](https://ohshitgit.com/) | When you need to fix Git mistakes |
| [Quarto Gallery](https://quarto.org/docs/gallery/) | When you want inspiration for new formats |

## Using AI Effectively

- Learn how to use CLI agent tools
  - Integrate them into your IDE tools
  - Connect them to your GitHub repository

- Learn how to use AI to help with your research workflow
  - Consider which tasks to delegate to AI
  - Learn "AI fluency" via [Anthropic Academy courses](https://anthropic.skilljar.com/) (highly recommended!)
